title: Trend Micro Deep Security
descriptionMarkdown: The Trend Micro Deep Security connector allows you to easily connect your Deep Security logs with Microsoft Sentinel, to view dashboards, create custom alerts, and improve investigation. This gives you more insight into your organization's networks/systems and improves your security operation capabilities.
additionalRequirementBanner:
These queries and workbooks are dependent on Kusto functions based on Kusto to work as expected. Follow the steps to use the Kusto functions alias "TrendMicroDeepSecurity" 
in queries and workbooks. [Follow steps to get this Kusto function.](https://aka.ms/TrendMicroDeepSecurityFunction)

sampleQueries.query:
TrendMicroDeepSecurity

            | where DeepSecurityModuleName == "Intrusion Prevention"
            | sort by TimeGenerated

TrendMicroDeepSecurity

            | where DeepSecurityModuleName == "Integrity Monitoring"
            | sort by TimeGenerated

TrendMicroDeepSecurity

            | where DeepSecurityModuleName == "Firewall Events"
            | sort by TimeGenerated

TrendMicroDeepSecurity

            | where DeepSecurityModuleName == "Log Inspection"
            | sort by TimeGenerated

TrendMicroDeepSecurity

            | where DeepSecurityModuleName == "Anti-Malware"
            | sort by TimeGenerated

TrendMicroDeepSecurity

            | where DeepSecurityModuleName == "Web Reputation"
            | sort by TimeGenerated

value:
TrendMicroDeepSecurity

            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

dataTypes.name: CommonSecurityLog (TrendMicroDeepSecurity)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
TrendMicroDeepSecurity

            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

instructionSteps.title: 1. Linux Syslog agent configuration
instructionSteps.description:
Install and configure the Linux agent to collect your Common Event Format (CEF) Syslog messages and forward them to Microsoft Sentinel.

> Notice that the data from all regions will be stored in the selected workspace

innerSteps.title: 1.1 Select or create a Linux machine
innerSteps.description: Select or create a Linux machine that Microsoft Sentinel will use as the proxy between your security solution and Microsoft Sentinel this machine can be on your on-prem environment, Azure or other clouds.

innerSteps.title: 1.2 Install the CEF collector on the Linux machine
innerSteps.description:
Install the Microsoft Monitoring Agent on your Linux machine and configure the machine to listen on the necessary port and forward messages to your Microsoft Sentinel workspace. The CEF collector collects CEF messages on port 514 TCP.

> 1. Make sure that you have Python on your machine using the following command: python -version.

> 2. You must have elevated permissions (sudo) on your machine.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Forward Trend Micro Deep Security logs to Syslog agent
instructionSteps.description:
1. Set your security solution to send Syslog messages in CEF format to the proxy machine. Make sure to send the logs to port 514 TCP on the machine's IP address.
2. Forward Trend Micro Deep Security events to the Syslog agent.
3. Define a new Syslog Configuration that uses the CEF format by referencing [this knowledge article](https://aka.ms/Sentinel-trendmicro-kblink)  for additional information.
4. Configure the Deep Security Manager to use this new configuration to forward events to the Syslog agent using [these instructions](https://aka.ms/Sentinel-trendMicro-connectorInstructions).
5. Make sure to save the [TrendMicroDeepSecurity](https://aka.ms/TrendMicroDeepSecurityFunction) function so that it queries the Trend Micro Deep Security data properly.

instructionSteps.title: 3. Validate connection
instructionSteps.description:
Follow the instructions to validate your connectivity:

Open Log Analytics to check if the logs are received using the CommonSecurityLog schema.

>It may take about 20 minutes until the connection streams data to your workspace.

If the logs are not received, run the following connectivity validation script:

> 1. Make sure that you have Python on your machine using the following command: python -version

>2. You must have elevated permissions (sudo) on your machine
